title: Question: Variant selecting different package parent types
body:
I've got a simple code implemented in lots of different programming models. We've got a CMake build system where you say:
```
cmake -Bbuild -H. -DMODEL=<model>  <model_specific_flags>
```

In Spack, I can create a package that inherits from `CMakePackage` and include a simple variant:
```
    variant('model', default='omp', description='Programming Model',
            values=('omp', 'sycl', 'cuda', ........), multi=False)
```
and then pass the selection to CMake:
```
    def cmake_args(self):
        return [self.define_from_variant('MODEL', 'model'),]
```

It might be convenient to inherit from the different package types depending on the variant value. For instance, if I chose `model=cuda` I might want to use the `CUDAPackage`, and with `model=sycl` I might want to *sometimes* use the the Intel OneAPI compiler and inherit from `IntelOneapiPackage` (sometimes I might want to use a different SYCL compiler).

I think I'm missing somewhere here, so hopefully you can advise on the best way to enable this selection in a Spack package for the application. Thanks!
